key_points: President Biden addressed the nation on the ongoing battle against COVID-19, highlighting the Delta variant's impact and the need for increased vaccination.
Biden announced a new plan to combat COVID-19, focusing on vaccination mandates for larger employers, increased testing, and school safety measures.
The plan includes a requirement for employers with 100+ employees to ensure their workforce is fully vaccinated or tested weekly.
Major companies like United Airlines, Disney, Tyson Foods, and Fox News are already implementing vaccination requirements.
The federal government will also require vaccinations for all workers in healthcare facilities that receive Medicare or Medicaid funding, impacting 17 million healthcare workers.
Biden will sign executive orders mandating vaccination for all federal employees and contractors who do business with the federal government.
The plan aims to keep schools safe and open, with a call for governors to require vaccinations for all teachers and staff.
An emphasis is placed on increasing testing and making it more accessible and affordable, with a promise to use the Defense Production Act to boost production of rapid tests.
Biden's plan also seeks to protect the economic recovery by expanding the COVID-19 Economic Injury Disaster Loan program for small businesses.
Efforts will continue to improve care for those with COVID-19, including increasing the distribution of monoclonal antibody treatments and ensuring equity in vaccine distribution.
